poems.title: Nocturnes, Op. 9: No. 1
content:
The stars twinkle so bright you seek a song, 
a nocturne with words to sing along. 
You draw a line between their bright shimmer,
Their dazzling lights you aim to decipher. 
With steadfast nature you scribe a sonnet, 
Its glimmer outshines a diamond locket
You paint starry nights that loom so high, 
With canvas you express and they reply. 
All the auroras' nuances you do pursue, 
Picking terms and meaning to make them true.
The stars are all yours,you know them the best
Only you can express them with such finesse.
But as you spout your rhythm and rhyme, 
The stars continue to sit there and shine.

poems.title: Unnamed 1
content:
May I be honest, my friend? No more lies?
I hate the scintillating stars so high.
Agoraphobic, they blight sightly skies;
With unsubtle twinkle, glib do they fly.
I hate the leaves too, in all shapes and shades:
They litter earth's ground with a rotting waste,
 and camouflage beautiful light green blades,
All to abandon ally tree in haste.
I hold you not in the likeness of these.
Unlike stars, selflessly you shine above,
Unlike leaves, you're an ally to the trees,
I lack hate for you; in that absence, love.
I wish this nuance you truly did see,
Making this poem not apostrophe.

poems.title: Gloss and Gripe
content:
Grapes glisten and shine
Foxes mouth waters but yet
Unreached grapes taste bad

poems.title: Haiku 1
content:
Flames dance in the wind—
The one who lit them stumbles,
Burns his own footsteps.

poems.title: Haiku 2
content:
Cherry blossoms fall.
The heart that seeks only joy
Misses deeper springs.

poems.title: Haiku 3
content:
Morning dew settles—
In the quiet garden bed
Worry cannot root.

poems.title: Haiku 4
content:
The child claps with joy—
Magic blooms only for hearts
That choose not to know.

poems.title: Haiku 5
content:
No faith in the heart—
the magician’s hand reveals
only dust and smoke.

poems.title: Haiku 6
content:
Lone sheep wanders far—
not the shepherd's gentle staff
but wolf-teeth guide home

poems.title: Haiku 7
content:
Sweet arrow enters—
I meant love, but blood flows black
from my fumbling hands

poems.title: Haiku 8
content:
Mask upon mask falls—
I am no one beneath them,
just empty stage-light

poems.title: Haiku 9
content:
God's crown weighs nothing—
I crush lambs with my thick fists,
call it shepherding

poems.title: Haiku 10
content:
My mouth bleeds foolish—
each word a fresh wound that teaches,
silence breeds nothing

poems.title: Haiku 11
content:
Masterless, He roam—
freedom tastes like rotting meat,
He howl at nothing

poems.title: Nor I
content:
Harrowing Henry questions
Eyes filled with pursuit, love
Does in death cause conflicts
Arise

Reincarnation with challenge,
presents; no fish loves on land.
Yet humbled Henry turned to frog,
Stretches legs to reach giraffes neck

Equally Evangelic posture prevents,
As hating Henry knows Hell as home.
Jacob’s visions Henry hopes come true 
Angels allow transcendental travel.

Still in most convenient form, burden
She will not bear, Henry watches on,
Her legs seem not budge.
As with predicament Romeo,
Juliet find solace in death 
-I saw nobody coming,
so I went instead.

poems.title: The Paradox, Etc.
content:
Sweat pools, mounded dirt,
unburrowed legume sprouts
for tiny hands uncomplaining.
Grow now alongside produce;
never to ripen.

Latin Lady Justice,
blind scales poised.
Fairness sought only in
impartial paradox.

Sāi Wēng Lost His Horse,
yet falls not for tricks of
fairness judged by man.
Illusions of justice guide 
only fool, whom sets blame
On all sets of two, when Noah’s 
Barge breaks, ignorant of 
Elephants in the room.

poems.title: Unnamed 2
content:
Why is it; Arctic Tern, adrift
in boundless sky - migration 
leads you further on.
And in sleepless flight; drifting
over lush lands bound together,
Inattentive glances seek stories,
in clouds, with none told.
Refuge is not lost, but forgone,
comfort left behind in eternal flight.

For you I’m grateful Arctic Tern,
As on your tour of this world, with
the tallest mountains, deepest oceans,
warmest summers, and coldest winters, 
here you chose to rest until you were;
Gone.

poems.title: Unnamed 3
content:
Camouflaged creature,
His tie, nature knotted, 
Adapted garb, suit the scene— 
Masked intentions,
Empowers his elusive deviance.
Lucky me, my house has thick walls.
Elect; a term of comfort;leaves me, 
Oblivious to adjacent dangers…
Now he’s got my daughter’s body.

poems.title: Conquester
content:
Beneath a sky of fractured violet,
 he stepped from steel, a stranger’s silhouette—
 a Martian cloaked in dust of rusted wars, 
to plant a flag where no flag had been set.

"This soil is ours," his amplifiers hissed, 
as drills bit deep where ancient rivers wept.
 He built his towers tall as fractured vows, 
while native winds, in tongues he silenced, crept.

The creatures there—all prism-winged and thorned— 
split into tribes: some knelt, some roared, "Be gone!"
 He fed them light from screens of bleeding ore, 
split truth to sparks, then sold each spark as dawn.

"Progress," he vowed, "requires unmarked earth,"
 yet mapped the veins of gold beneath their feet.
 His laws were coded in unspoken thirst— 
to own, to take, to make the pulse retreat.

But in the cracks where his machines forgot,
 a murmur grew—a chorus from the roots.
 The oldest stones began to hum a chord
 that bent his grids and choked his hollow fruits.

Now watch this world, half-shadowed, split in two: 
one half his myth, one half the wild’s reply.
 What blooms where empires of the void collide? 
Not conquest’s yield, but seeds that question why.

poems.title: Unnamed 4
content:
The cold burns my lip and ears
displeasing ice fills veins to my knees
self contained my complaints I fear,
Childish whining is, when dressed to freeze.

poems.title: A Dog's Five O'Clock Meal
content:
Hopeless Henry writes to God, “Why,
why do you plague me with sadness.
This debt of tears is not one I owe, does not
my prayer and unwavering toil merit joy?”

To this God replies, "I have endowed 
you with all that is rightfully yours, my child.
I entrust to you not a prebuilt heaven,
but the means to forge your own eden, 
and in this life, I bequeath not just a mere smile, 
but the visage that may conjure one."

Humbled Henry finds painful resolve in God's reply,
While Halted Henry dreads that; with him all is left. 
He comprehends he's earned nothing—neither skies, trees, nor stars, 
For beguiling words often waltz as pretty lies for him to embrace.
Hopeful Henry rests again in hollow grave 
with only bones to keep him warm.

poems.title: The Muse
content:
Lashed in vermilion, Peter’s Muse awoke—
her hair a riot of glyphs, her eyes undone—
O, what immortal grievance did I stoke
to birth this Fury, scribbled, sly, outrun?

She peeled the hours like varnish from a frame,
 & lo! the canvas screamed in tongues of blue: 
You plucked my wings for ink, now feast on shame,
 you, drunk on sonnets, lost in subplot stew.

Her scissors snipped the chronology of days,
 each cut a stanza, fractured, overgrown— Peter, 
agog, chewed verbs in dismal praise: 
The plot’s her own, the wreckage mine alone.

The palette knives she wielded, cruel & bright, 
flayed hymns from his ribs, left psalms in the rain. 
O Muse, he cried, unmap this spite, 
but she gridlocked the sky with her migraine train.

Now Peter’s text is braille, his page a pyre,
 her vengeance stitched in every glyphic thorn.
her voice a strike of fire, she yelled in scorn
I’ll keep you company for his eyes began to tire

poems.title: Unnamed 5
content:
In hours, are making of minutes,
within which several seconds.
to lose half forever is not all lost.
We care not for created time,
but yet create time for what we care.

poems.title: La Grenouillère
content:
Less he impressionist —  
pride not in the draft,  
I cannot value mine  
existence until it
is not

poems.title: The Blameless Diplomat
content:
Blame dropped on circumstance,
wasteful; as the fisherman who’s
legs soak upstream.
Those with naught knowledge,
are easily tempted by evil fruits.
Intellects justify red horrors, with 
maps of green and blue.

I beseech you, 
who bears the burden of pain,
unbearable,
who is at fault?
The ruler Macbeth, with which
lovers death, orchestrated;
result of plan and deceit,
or lover Romeo, who’s maiden
killed, by his inability to see harm,
in guise of love.

poems.title: The Grandiose of a Sand Castle
content:
Beautiful Birds reflections call, tiny skulls
snap wetting their beaks in glass. En-groused;
Blossoming lovers snap stems from earth, bar
those who’s worn whimsy presents.

The most delectable canines, 
their fangs so refined, 
eat only dust, never bones, with 
Mouths left arid, bellies abandoned to solitude 

Prize hog squeals, while bovine  companions' 
mournful moos curdle  in lament, birthing an 
escalation  of prices with a volatile fervor 

Before flames engulfed each pedal, 
 now their grey hues match only the 
empty hedge-stone.
Elegant bones below, sing their  song 
only for those forgotten, with no time left to listen.

poems.title: Haiku 12
content:
letter, number, me.
Rulers track my diffident mind,
I’d rate this a C.

poems.title: Nocturnes, Op. 32: No. 1
content:
Felix Mendelssohn, master
of the songbird’s tongue, once confessed
—a thought on Chopin’s prelude—

"I love it. I cannot tell you how much
or why, only that it is something
I could never have written myself."

Was it the failure to etch such notes
on paper that stirred him?
Perhaps—but I veer away.
Mendelssohn’s struggle,
not of hand or ear, but of existence itself.

As Chopin's heart pumped beat,
escaping the confines of repetition, 
so too, our days move—

Even the author writing my Monday 
misses the way the air hums

poems.title: The Game of Mao
content:
If we began, break conven'thn 
disgruntled, father if he a literate man. 
do'er hear language of meow o bark 
neir yet broken made sentence.
I commit a disservice? for I pray not, 
yesterdays child tears skin from aspen 
fear not- or fear - weightless skin 
places no urgency onto his gavel.

"What your acts to me father" 
swine skin... no, an earful graize
will not do — allowed onward to drown
mine land, thou neighbor land,
piggish spit and slober.
O is father not a lawful man?
Harvard ought offer scolarships.

Assign suit to testiment,
thus warrants discussion of Mao's game.
Were not I privy to your language;
Am I now subject to sink?

poems.title: Nothin' Hurt a Koala
content:
I've spoken a quote, 
know not of who said. 
But it seemed pretty important
when out loud it's read.

I've bought these new shoes, 
know not how they're made. 
But they fit me so nicely 
when conscience can fade.

I've spread their message,
know not what it means. 
But sharing feels righteous 
through my glowing screens.

I've signed their petition, 
know not what it seeks. 
But my name looks important 
when the cause barely speaks.

I've elected a man, 
know not what he'll do. 
But his promises glisten 
when I'm not looking through.

They've moved out my neighbor, 
know not where they've gone. 
But property values risen 
since they moved along.

I've razed the last forest, 
know not what once grew. 
The concrete spreads easier 
when green turns to blue.

I've poisoned the river, 
know not what drinks there. 
The water runs clearer 
when less breathe the air.

I've silenced the voices, 
know not what they'd say. 
But peace sounds like music 
when dissent fades away.

I've created a bomb, 
know not who it hurts. 
But the silence feels golden
when the screaming reverts.

I've ended the world, 
know not what comes next. 
Yet here in my comfort, 
I remain unperplexed.
